alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Douglas (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 16 at 2:26AM PDT until May 22 at 4:27PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah, Lewis, Nez Perce and Shoshone. Portions of Washington, including the following counties, Asotin, Chelan, Douglas, Ferry, Garfield, Okanogan, Pend Oreille, Spokane, Stevens and Whitman. * WHEN...From 11 AM PDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars, steep terrain and urbanized areas with poor drainage will be especially susceptible to flash flooding with thunderstorms. Excessive rain with thunderstorms may also result in debris flows near burn scars or in steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms will develop late this morning and into the afternoon and evening hours. Thunderstorms will be capable of torrential rainfall with rain rates of over an inch per hour under the strongest cells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
